Interface Initializer<I>

Type Parameters:
I - the type of contextual instance
All Superinterfaces:
Aggregate
public interface Initializer<I> extends Aggregate
An interface whose implementations initialize contextual instances.

Initializers are subordinate to Producers, typically operating on the contextual instances they produce.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
  • initialize(Object, Request)

    assign

  • Method Details

    • assign

      default SequencedSet<? extends Assignment<?>> assign(Request<?> r)
      A convenience method that assigns a contextual reference to each of this Initializer's AttributedElement instances and returns the resulting SequencedSet of Assignments.

      Typically there is no need to override this method.

      Parameters:
      r - a Request that retrieves a contextual reference suitable for an AttributedType; must not be null
      Returns:
      an immutable SequencedSet of Assignment instances; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if r is null
      See Also:
      • Aggregate.assign(java.util.function.Function)

    • dependencies

      default SequencedSet<AttributedElement> dependencies()
      Returns an immutable SequencedSet of AttributedElement instances required for instance initialization only.

      The returned SequencedSet may be, and often is, empty.

      Overriding this method is normal and expected.

      Any overrides of this method must return determinate values.

      Specified by:
      dependencies in interface Aggregate
      Returns:
      an immutable SequencedSet of AttributedElement instances; never null
      See Also:
      • Aggregate.dependencies()
      • Aggregate.assign(java.util.function.Function)
      • initialize(Object, SequencedSet)
      • AttributedElement

    • initialize

      default I initialize(I i, Request<I> r)
      Initializes the supplied contextual instance, possibly using the supplied Request to obtain supporting contextual references.

      Typically Initializer implementations will perform field injection and then will call initializer methods on the supplied contextual instance.

      Normally there is no need to override the default implementation of this method, which calls the initialize(Object, SequencedSet) method with Assignments derived from this Initializer's dependencies.

      Parameters:
      i - the contextual instance to initialize; may be null
      r - a Request that can be used to acquire supporting contextual references; may be null
      Returns:
      the initialized instance, or a copy of it, or a stand-in for it
      See Also:
      • initialize(Object, SequencedSet)

    • initialize

      I initialize(I i, SequencedSet<? extends Assignment<?>> assignments)
      Initializes the supplied contextual instance, possibly (often) making use of the supplied, dependent, contextual references.

      Implementations of this method must not call initialize(Object, Request) or an infinite loop may result.

      Typically Initializer implementations will perform field injection and then will call initializer methods on the supplied contextual instance.

      Parameters:
      i - the contextual instance to initialize; may be null
      assignments - a SequencedSet of Assignments to be distributed appropriately among fields and initializer methods; must not be null
      Returns:
      the initialized instance, or a copy of it, or a stand-in for it
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if assignments is null
      See Also:
      • Producer.produce(Request)
